jd_format.value:
Job Title

HR Business Partner

Job Code

HRBP-001

Overview

As an HR Business Partner at Humble Bridge, you will play a pivotal role in aligning our HR strategy with business objectives. You will be responsible for workforce planning, succession planning, leadership coaching, and labor relations. Your expertise will help shape the employee experience and drive organizational design and change management initiatives.

Company Overview

Humble Bridge is a leading AI/ML company dedicated to driving digital transformation across various industries. We pride ourselves on our innovative solutions and commitment to excellence.

Roles & Responsibilities

  • Develop and implement HR strategies aligned with the overall business strategy.
  • Manage workforce planning and succession planning.
  • Provide leadership coaching and support labor relations.
  • Enhance employee experience through organizational design and change management.
  • Assist in the development of HR policies and procedures.
  • Support recruitment and onboarding processes.

Requirements

  • Degree in Business Administration, Psychology, International Cultural and Business Studies, or related field.
  • Advanced degree in HR or related field is a plus.
  • 5 years of experience.
  • HR certification such as SHRM-CP or PHR is preferred.
  • Fluent in English (business), conversational in German.
  • Must be authorized to work in Austria.

Skills

Must-have Skills

  • General knowledge of HR practices and Austrian labor law.
  • Familiarity with Microsoft Office and/or Google Workspace.
  • Strong leadership, communication, and organizational skills.

Nice-to-have Skills

  • Experience with HRIS systems.
  • Ability to manage multiple priorities and work under pressure.

Compensation and Benefits

  • Competitive salary based on experience.
  • Performance-based bonuses.
  • Comprehensive health insurance, paid time off, and retirement benefits.
  • A dynamic work environment with opportunities for growth and development.

Entry

Immediate availability preferred.

Company Info

Interested candidates should apply with their resume and cover letter.

Address: Humble Bridge, Vienna, Austria

Application Instructions

Submit your application through our careers page or email it to hr@humblebridge.com.

Reporting Line

Reports to the Head of Human Resources.

Measures of Outcome

Successful implementation of HR strategies and improvement in employee satisfaction metrics.

Work Environment

  • Standard business hours with some flexibility.
  • Minimal travel required.
  • Full-time
  • Onsite in Vienna, Austria
  • Permanent
  • Primarily a desk job with occasional meetings.

No. of Openings

1

Industry Type

AI/ML

Department

Human Resources

Application Deadline

2023-11-15

Equal Employment Opportunity (EEO) Statement

Humble Bridge is an equal opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees.

Diversity and Inclusion Statement

We believe in the power of diversity and inclusion to drive innovation and success. Our team is committed to fostering a culture where everyone feels valued and respected.

Interview Rounds

The interview process includes an initial phone screening, followed by two rounds of interviews with HR and department heads.

Level

Mid-level
